description: Conversion of upper floor levels into five flats and retention of retail use (A1) at ground floor level with ancillary accommodation at basement level, part single, two and three storey rear extensions (following the demolition of part of the rear of the existing warehouse), provision of additional storey at third floor level over the main building, provision of canopy, lightwell, bin store and external alterations to front facade
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Notwithstanding the materials indicated on the submitted drawings or the samples submitted to date, details of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and the approved details shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the building, and shall be permanently retained.   1) Revised details of the bin store and front canopy.    Reason: To ensure that the development achieves a quality external appearance and harmonises with surrounding development and land uses in the area, and to ensure compliance with the Police requirements of Secured By Design and with adopted UDP requirements in regards to refuse/recycling storage and collection facilities, in accordance with the Councils Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'New Plan for the Environment' (12/10/04) policies 4.1, 4.3, 4.4, 4.12 and 5.5. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of any of the flats hereby permitted, and retained permanently.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby authorised shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design.   Reason: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | Details of a demolition and construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  Reason: To ensure that any impacts on residential amenity and general disruption are minimised during the construction process related to the total development hereby approved, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The application site shall only be used as a retail unit (A1 use) with ancillary office and storage area as shown on the approved drawings, and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), without planning permission first being obtained via the submission of a planning application to the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with site's location with a Town Centre and a Designated Shopping Frontage, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers in the locality and highway safety, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, detailed scaled drawings (Scale 1:20 or above) showing the design, external appearance, and materials of the shopfront, including the provision for disabled people to gain access to the premises, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences and the details so approved shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and to ensure adequate access is provided for people with disabilities, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3, and 4.10 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of a scheme for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) from external noise, including commercial noise, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 Of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application, details of soundproofing between the retail premises and the residential accommodation above shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the conversion of the premises. The soundproofing scheme shall be installed in accordance with the approved details prior to the commencement of the residential use and retained for the duration of the use.  Reason: To maintain and protect the residential amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
